thread.title: Joey Kramer is set to open an Aerosmith-themed restaurant in Maine - Music
thread.title_full: Joey Kramer is set to open an Aerosmith-themed restaurant in Maine - Music News - Digital Spy

author: Harry Fletcher
title: Joey Kramer is set to open an Aerosmith-themed restaurant in Maine - Music
text: Aerosmith fans in Maine are in for a special culinary treat, after it was announced that the band's drummer Joey Kramer is opening an Aerosmith-themed restaurant.The musician will open the Rockin' & Roastin' Café & Restaurant in Newry in December. © PA Images / Ed Ou/AP As well as a restaurant - decorated with rock 'n' roll memorabilia – the new establishment will feature a coffee house with views of Sunday River Mountain.Kramer will team up with former Boston Red Sox vice chairman Les Otten for the venture, and the two released a statement detailing their plans for the new restaurant."The exterior of the building will be reskinned, and the interior will undergo a total revamp fit for rock royalty," the release read. "Among the unique memorabilia on display will be Kramer's drum kit from the recent Aerosmith 'Global Warming Tour' – a hand painted, glow-in-the-dark ensemble – making it a one-of-a-kind piece of rock history." © Fox / Michael BeckerSteven Tyler of Aerosmith performs on stage Diners are in for a treat with the food too, after Kramer revealed some of the brilliant names that we can expect to see on the menu."The menu items will be named with fun twists on Aerosmith hits such as 'Janie's Got a Bun' and 'Livin' on a Wedge'."Elsewhere, Steven Tyler recently asked Donald Trump to stop using Aerosmith song 'Dream On' at campaign events.Watch the video for Aerosmith's 'I Don't Wanna Miss a Thing' below:
